column4: newbie question: I plan on switching from xp to either ubuntu linux or some variant of freebsd.  since im using xp right now, unsurprisingly my HDDs are formatted NTFS. when my live cd iso finishes downloading, and i boot the disc, what will my HDDs show up as? at all? read-only?
you will have to resize your windows partition(s) to make room for linux on that drive(s)
ubuntu automatically mounts all your windows drives so you can access the files
ok. there's a large faq in the ubuntu wiki that will help you out when you do.
